<Link id="l00079" /><CodeLine lineNumber="79"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Represents the cost of inlining a function.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00080" /><CodeLine lineNumber="80"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00081" /><CodeLine lineNumber="81"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// This supports special values for functions which should &quot;always&quot; or</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00082" /><CodeLine lineNumber="82"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// &quot;never&quot; be inlined. Otherwise, the cost represents a unitless amount;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00083" /><CodeLine lineNumber="83"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// smaller values increase the likelihood of the function being inlined.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00084" /><CodeLine lineNumber="84"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00085" /><CodeLine lineNumber="85"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Objects of this type also provide the adjusted threshold for inlining</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00086" /><CodeLine lineNumber="86"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// based on the information available for a particular callsite. They can be</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00087" /><CodeLine lineNumber="87"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// directly tested to determine if inlining should occur given the cost and</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00088" /><CodeLine lineNumber="88"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// threshold for this cost metric.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00195" /><CodeLine lineNumber="195"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00196" /><CodeLine lineNumber="196"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Thresholds to tune inline cost analysis. The inline cost analysis decides</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00197" /><CodeLine lineNumber="197"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// the condition to apply a threshold and applies it. Otherwise,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00198" /><CodeLine lineNumber="198"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// DefaultThreshold is used. If a threshold is Optional, it is applied only</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00199" /><CodeLine lineNumber="199"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// when it has a valid value. Typically, users of inline cost analysis</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00200" /><CodeLine lineNumber="200"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// obtain an InlineParams object through one of the \\c getInlineParams methods</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00201" /><CodeLine lineNumber="201"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// and pass it to \\c getInlineCost. Some specialized versions of inliner</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00202" /><CodeLine lineNumber="202"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// (such as the pre-inliner) might have custom logic to compute \\c InlineParams</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00203" /><CodeLine lineNumber="203"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// object.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00204" /><CodeLine lineNumber="204"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00205" /><CodeLine lineNumber="205" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/inlineparams"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">struct </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/inlineparams">InlineParams</a> &#123;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00309" /><CodeLine lineNumber="309"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Get the cost estimate ignoring thresholds. This is similar to getInlineCost</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00317" /><CodeLine lineNumber="317"><span class="doxyHighlight">std::optional&lt;int&gt; <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ac9362dadd20c02f3227f93421cb8829d">getInliningCostEstimate</a>(</span></CodeLine>
